verses.verse: To the chief Musician<WH5329> for the sons<WH1121> of Korah,<WH7141> Maschil.<WH4905> We have heard<WH8085> with our ears,<WH241> O God,<WH430> our fathers<WH1> have told<WH5608> us, what work<WH6467> thou didst<WH6466> in their days,<WH3117> in the times<WH3117> of old.<WH6924>
How thou<WH859> didst drive out<WH3423> the heathen<WH1471> with thy hand,<WH3027> and plantedst<WH5193> them; how thou didst afflict<WH7489> the people,<WH3816> and cast them out.<WH7971>

For <WH3588> they got not<WH3808> the land<WH776> in possession<WH3423> by their own sword,<WH2719> neither<WH3808> did their own arm<WH2220> save<WH3467> them: but<WH3588> thy right hand,<WH3225> and thine arm,<WH2220> and the light<WH216> of thy countenance,<WH6440> because<WH3588> thou hadst a favor<WH7521> unto them.
Thou <WH859> art my King,<WH4428> O God:<WH430> command<WH6680> deliverances<WH3444> for Jacob.<WH3290>
Through thee will we push down<WH5055> our enemies:<WH6862> through thy name<WH8034> will we tread them under<WH947> that rise up against<WH6965> us.
For <WH3588> I will not<WH3808> trust<WH982> in my bow,<WH7198> neither<WH3808> shall my sword<WH2719> save<WH3467> me.
But <WH3588> thou hast saved<WH3467> us from our enemies,<WH4480> <WH6862> and hast put them to shame<WH954> that hated<WH8130> us.
In God<WH430> we boast<WH1984> all<WH3605> the day<WH3117> long, and praise<WH3034> thy name<WH8034> forever.<WH5769> Selah.<WH5542>
But <WH637> thou hast cast off,<WH2186> and put us to shame;<WH3637> and goest not forth<WH3318> <WH3808> with our armies.<WH6635>
Thou makest us to turn<WH7725> back<WH268> from<WH4480> the enemy:<WH6862> and they which hate<WH8130> us spoil<WH8154> for themselves.
Thou hast given<WH5414> us like sheep<WH6629> appointed for meat;<WH3978> and hast scattered<WH2219> us among the heathen.<WH1471>
Thou sellest<WH4376> thy people<WH5971> for naught,<WH3808> <WH1952> and dost not<WH3808> increase<WH7235> thy wealth by their price.<WH4242>
Thou makest<WH7760> us a reproach<WH2781> to our neighbors,<WH7934> a scorn<WH3933> and a derision<WH7047> to them that are round about<WH5439> us.
Thou makest<WH7760> us a byword<WH4912> among the heathen,<WH1471> a shaking<WH4493> of the head<WH7218> among the people.<WH3816>
My confusion<WH3639> is continually<WH3605> <WH3117> before<WH5048> me, and the shame<WH1322> of my face<WH6440> hath covered<WH3680> me,
For the voice<WH4480> <WH6963> of him that reproacheth<WH2778> and blasphemeth;<WH1442> by reason<WH4480> <WH6440> of the enemy<WH341> and avenger.<WH5358>
All <WH3605> this<WH2063> is come upon<WH935> us; yet have we not<WH3808> forgotten<WH7911> thee, neither<WH3808> have we dealt falsely<WH8266> in thy covenant.<WH1285>
Our heart<WH3820> is not<WH3808> turned<WH5472> back,<WH268> neither have our steps<WH838> declined<WH5186> from<WH4480> thy way;<WH734>
Though <WH3588> thou hast sore broken<WH1794> us in the place<WH4725> of dragons,<WH8577> and covered<WH3680> <WH5921> us with the shadow of death.<WH6757>
If <WH518> we have forgotten<WH7911> the name<WH8034> of our God,<WH430> or stretched out<WH6566> our hands<WH3709> to a strange<WH2114> god;<WH410>
Shall not<WH3808> God<WH430> search<WH2713> this<WH2063> out? for<WH3588> he<WH1931> knoweth<WH3045> the secrets<WH8587> of the heart.<WH3820>
Yea, <WH3588> for<WH5921> thy sake are we killed<WH2026> all<WH3605> the day<WH3117> long; we are counted<WH2803> as sheep<WH6629> for the slaughter.<WH2878>
Awake, <WH5782> why<WH4100> sleepest<WH3462> thou, O Lord?<WH136> arise,<WH6974> cast<WH2186> us not<WH408> off forever.<WH5331>
Wherefore <WH4100> hidest<WH5641> thou thy face,<WH6440> and forgettest<WH7911> our affliction<WH6040> and our oppression?<WH3906>
For <WH3588> our soul<WH5315> is bowed down<WH7743> to the dust:<WH6083> our belly<WH990> cleaveth<WH1692> unto the earth.<WH776>
Arise <WH6965> for our help,<WH5833> and redeem<WH6299> us for thy mercies' sake.<WH4616> <WH2617>
